reviews.review_msg: I don't know why people think 'spoon feeding' students is such a bad thing. She's an excellent professor, very compassionate and adds a funny remark now and then. I hated Canadian history though for some reason I managed to pull a B so far in her class. Coincidence?

Drop dead easy course. She spoon feeds the new kids. This is a good thing, since most profs expect new students to immediately make the jump from high school style. Though very helpful, and clearly wanting you to learn, she effectively 'reads from the book' during lecture, making it dull as paint drying and often ambiguous as to what's important.
